title: The “Cooking” book
content:
[[>]]
[[module Rate]]
[[/>]]

**Item #:** SCP-8196

**Object Class:** Safe

**Special Containment Procedures:** 
SCP-8196 is to be locked in a translucent glass box, approximately 1.5 x 1.5 meters in height. Under no curcumstances should the book be taken out, unless approved by a fecillity guard with level 3 clearance and the senior scientist on site.

**Description:** SCP-8196 is a cookbook with a cover 1.21 inches thick, with no writing other than the word “cookbook”. If opened, said opener will be attracted to cook these recipies. There are 189 pages, with 13 having been ripped out or incinerated. The cover shows signs of damage but remains intact.

If reading a recipe, you will notice none of these materials are on hand. The anomolous property of SCP-8196 is that when the recipe name is said, the recipe’s result will appear about 1-2 feet away from the user’s position.

**Addendum:** 
**subject:** Recipe 32; ‘Perfect’ Omolette
14:32: D-252854 subjected to SCP-8196.
14:33: Subject opens book and says recipe name.
14:35: D-252854 find omolette and eats it.
14:36: Subject bends over, vomiting blood up to 4 feet away.
14:37: Subject dead.

**subject:** Recipe 13: Flesh Soup
Agent [Redacted] opens SCP-8196 by accident during a breach by SCP-173. He was hungry, so Agent [Redacted] said the name of recipe 13.
12 hours later, his body was found. The reason of death was not SCP-8196, SCP-173 had supposedly got him before he drank the soup.
